intro: Ecbolium dasycarpum, commonly known as the rough-seeded ecbolium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its upright, herbaceous stems and small, triangular leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces clusters of greenish-white flowers that bloom in early summer. Its fruit is a dry capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Ecbolium dasycarpum is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
